command: dism /Mount-Wim /WimFile:C:\Images\install.wim /Index:1 /MountDir:C:\Mount\Install; $h=(Get-FileHash 'C:\Mount\Install\Windows\System32\winlogon.exe' -Algorithm SHA256).Hash; if ($h -ne (Get-Content 'C:\Baselines\winlogon.exe.sha256')) { Write-Output 'winlogon.exe tampered in image' }; dism /Unmount-Wim /MountDir:C:\Mount\Install /Discard
explanation: Computes an offline hash of a critical binary within the mounted image and compares it to a baseline to detect unauthorized patching inside the system image.
rationale_steps: Mount the system image for offline file access.
Hash a critical system binary inside the image.
Compare with a trusted baseline checksum to detect tampering.
Unmount the image without saving changes.
